alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 7:51AM CDT until June 07 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Canadian County in central Oklahoma... Northern Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Northern McClain County in central Oklahoma... Southern Oklahoma County in central Oklahoma... * Until 1100 AM CDT. * At 751 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Oklahoma City, northern Norman, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Newcastle, Bethany, Mustang, Choctaw, Warr Acres, Harrah, Spencer, Nicoma Park, Valley Brook, Tinker Air Force Base, Stanley Draper Lake, Stella, northern Lake Thunderbird, Newalla and Forest Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 115 and 130. Interstate 44 between mile markers 108 and 123. Interstate 40 between mile markers 141 and 172. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 16. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
